page.title: 02Farming in North Devon
page.content: John Cook has one full time and one part time worker.He has 23 machines and 9 sheds.They grow barley,grass and corn.He has 305 acres of which 27 fields are used for animals,and 3 used for hay.He has 484 animals all together:cows,dairy cows and sheep.He milks the cows twice a day.This takes 3 hours.This year his cows have produced 105 calves and his sheep 350 lambs.This year he produced 750 tons of silage and 2000 bales of hay. The farm house is around 485 years old, and 4 generations of his family have lived at West Heddon.He enjoys farming alot and eats his own products:milk,beef and lamb.He works on the farm for 10 to 12 hours a day. In his leisure time he plays skittles and drinks at the local pub. Ann Hale
